contentrichtext.text: The '''Norma Fleck Award for Canadian Children’s Non-Fiction''' is a lucrative literary award founded in May 1999 by the [[Fleck Family Foundation]] and the [[Canadian Children's Book Centre]], and presented to the year's best [[non-fiction]] book for a youth audience. Each year's winner receives [[CDN$]]10,000. The award is one of several presented by the Canadian Children's Book Centre each year; others include the [[Marilyn Baillie Picture Book Award]], the [[Geoffrey Bilson Award|Geoffrey Bilson Award for Historical Fiction for Young People]] and the [[TD Canadian Children's Literature Award]].<ref name=cbc>[http://www.cbc.ca/arts/books/story/2010/11/11/childrens-book-awards.html "Sask., Man. writers win for children's books"].
